Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

subject: Re: Invoice from Nick Lingris
body:
Hello! I don’t see the pdf. What nick is asking for?
Is he a linguist? For compass/scoro most of the times we put 1 line to quote QA of all and if that project included translation, yes, that would be included in that line.
On one side, check all project files. There must be an excel or word where you see the quote details.
On the other side, check if adding as cost what Nick is asking is within budget/margin of what we charged the client.
Best,
CDS

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
 
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
 
 
 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
 
Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Subject:
 Re: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. 
This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. 
Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? 
If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent
Randi Mooney (Doran),
 she/her
Advisory Specialist II, Advisory & Consulting Services
rmooney@diligent.com
 | 
diligent.com

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Translation Specialist
LCW

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...

3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.

Hello Randi,

If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
 
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
 
 
 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
 
Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

EXTERNAL:
 This email originated from outside of the organization. Do not click links or open attachments unless you recognize the sender and know the content is safe.
 
Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
 
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
 
 
 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
 
Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,

There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Subject:

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Convercent LMS offers information on course start and close time, the package score, and the employee who took the course. They don't have the ability to pull data that shows information on quiz answers or COI answers on a slide. Providing the OData guide which includes detailed information on the Education tables and the data points that are provided.

Hi Catalina,
 
Ok, if any availability pops up today, please let me know and I will make that time work. But in the meantime, sent over an invite for Friday.
 
Here is a summary of the situation:
Del Monte noted earlier this week that the SCORM 2004 test file worked well in their LMS but followed up asking if we could send them their test report.
We informed them that without explicit access to their LMS and metadata, it would not be possible to generate a report on their behalf.
They replied that their LMS does not allow for any reports to be exported. This is where the misunderstanding occurred.
Earlier in the project, it was interpreted that they were not getting the desired information from SCORM 1.2 completion reports. That is why we decided to proceed with SCORM 2004 as it allows for customized reportage.
We have asked Del Monte to confirm with their LMS, Convercent, what type of reports or metadata can be generated or exported. Awaiting a response here.
Questions to discuss:
Is there any way to run a report on behalf of Del Monte?
Have reporting capabilities been brought up in the prior year updates for Del Monte? If so, what was the recommendation?
Thanks!
_________________________
Diligent

body:
No worries!!!
Yes you should send an estimate. I think we agreed there was some cost for this but I don’t remember. Do you know what to charge?
I’m also thinking that per Dustin’s email, maybe a Friday request can get a Tues delivery. We can chat about that later. 
Lmk if you need help. And don’t worry about bugging me. I don’t mind!!
On Mar 28, 2025, at 3:53 PM, Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com> wrote:
﻿
 
Soorry to bother you while you are off!!
I have asked Dustin to proceed but he is charging us 3 hours, should I say 3 hours of QA time to Randy so we can cover Dustin costs this time? I thought it was simpler but Im afraid we will have to charge them. Should I send them an estimate for approval?
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Best,
Dustin

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.

Nicole

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.

3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.

The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.

3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.

Asunto:
 Re: Fw: Diligent - WO_DELMONTE_COC_080624 - Del Monte CoC
 
This will have a 3 hr charge from myself at $65/hr. Because they have a wrapper it needs to be tested and built in a bigger way than just published a SCORM for them.
 
I'll get this done by Monday for you to aid in helping Diligent, but similar to LCW for future projects we'll want to establish the timeline turnarounds that help LCW, have been standard with Diligent, as well on my end. Myself and my team don't always work through the weekend so it will be good to know how to space things out for predictability. It's best to assume I'm Mon-Fri but we can always talk case by case though! 
 
 
 
I hope you have a good weekend! And we'll talk next week.
 
Best,
Dustin

We have received some edits from client, please find them attached.

Can we have this back on Monday EOD? Please let me know also if any extra charges so we can communicate with client.
Thank you!
Cecilia

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 Diligent & misc. stuff
 
Hi Cecilia,
 
Happy Friday!
 
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
 
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
 
Sure thing, I thought they only needed us if anything in progress
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is s
till awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Is there any quote im not awaere of? Ill share it on Monday for sure!
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... 
It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 
🙂
. 
I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
 
You are right, keep this in mind
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... 
Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. 
I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy
! I agree, I need to understand what he does because im still lost there ill reach out to him now and cc you there.
I did not forget about 
onboarding docs for translators
. 
Will look at that by next week. 
Will try to get to it this morning.
 
No rush on this!!
 
LMK if you have any questions/thoughts.
Thank you Cecilia!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

body:
Hello Dustin,
 
We have received some edits from client, please find them attached.
Del Monte has completed an internal review of the provided SCORMs. During this review, they found some items that they would like to have updated across four languages: Italian, Chinese, French, and Japanese.
 
Can we have this back on Monday EOD? Please let me know also if any extra charges so we can communicate with client.
Thank you!
Cecilia

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Dustin,
 
We have received some edits from client, please find them attached.
Del Monte has completed an internal review of the provided SCORMs. During this review, they found some items that they would like to have updated across four languages: Italian, Chinese, French, and Japanese.
 
Can we have this back on Monday EOD? Please let me know also if any extra charges so we can communicate with client.
Thank you!
Cecilia 
 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

Hello Randi,
 
Thank you for your patience.
 
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
 
<image.png>
 
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
 
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole
 
 
Nicole Barile

Hello Randi,
 
On the call you had with Dustin and Del Monte we noticed their LMS is limiting them in the main way they want to seek reportage. We can adjust the package to give them scores or try to adapt to their system of distinguishing learners with such limited LMS reporting features. But as shown with our testing, the packages have worked and we'll need their LMS to send us the exact settings that will be needed to accompany Del Monte's method of how they plan to distinguish learners who said Yes or No on the questionnaire. 
 
Perhaps their system only shows a complete pass/fail scenario? We'd need guidance from their LMS on how scores are captured and if it can distinguish a 50% score that "fails" but still passes the course. 
 
Please note our so long back and forth comes from their limiting system and as you can notice we are flexible and doing our best to help them get what they need.
Please let us know.
We are happy to help.
Best,
CDS
 
 
 
Catalina De Sanctis
Translation Specialist
LCW

I just sent the question to Convercent but in the screenshot shared, it showed a score of 100 for completion and a blank score for incompletion, so I don't think it is pass/fail score? The issue we have is that we can't distinguish all blank scores that are incomplete, and we don't know if in fact they completed the course. We could even be ok with a blank score if the participant was able to complete the course.

subject: DILIGENT PROCESS
body:
Hi Dustin,
 
Its me again I hope you are getting ready to enjoy the weekend!
Im reaching out because since all our calendars are a little bit complicated, Id like to ask you if you could send us a step-by-step of the diligent process in written so I can take a look and reach out to you with specific questions about the process.
 
Is it possible to have it next week? I really want to understand how it works because im still lost here.
 
Thank you!
Cecilia 
Cecilia Mariotta
Translation Specialist
LCW

De:
 Nicole Barile <n.barile@lcwmail.com> 
Enviado el:
 viernes, 28 de marzo de 2025 11:39
Para:
 Cecilia Mariotta <c.mariotta@lcwmail.com>
Asunto:
 Diligent & misc. stuff
 
Hi Cecilia,
 
Happy Friday!
 
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
 
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
 
Sure thing, I thought they only needed us if anything in progress
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is s
till awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Is there any quote im not awaere of? Ill share it on Monday for sure!
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... 
It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 
🙂
. 
I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
 
You are right, keep this in mind
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... 
Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. 
I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy
! I agree, I need to understand what he does because im still lost there ill reach out to him now and cc you there.
I did not forget about 
onboarding docs for translators
. 
Will look at that by next week. 
Will try to get to it this morning.
 
No rush on this!!
 
LMK if you have any questions/thoughts.
Thank you Cecilia!
 
 
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW

Hello Randi,
Thank you for your patience.
There is now a v3 version in the folder on your server (see image). 
If the user selects "No, they have nothing to report" they get 100% score and a Complete trigger. If they select "Yes, they have something to report", they get 50% and a Completion trigger. If the user does not complete the course properly or move past the "Review" slide, they will retain an incomplete with no score.
<image.png>
Our team was trying to make this work with the least impact to all the other languages - to keep cost low for this customization added after translation....so it took a bit longer than expected.
Please let us know if you run into any issues.
Best,
Nicole

Thanks for setting up the call Randi!
 
The three propositions I propose if they are not able to get reportage from their LMS using the SCORM 2004 file type...
 
1. Adding a print screen button to save a slide and their text entry, that appears with instructional text regarding who the learner can send the saved image to.
 
2. Adding an email instead of a textbox that instructs the learner to email somebody if they have a comment.
 
3. Adding a link to a Del Monte hosted survey (Survey Monkey or other tools) that allows the learner to to submit that text independent of the module. This option works best in my opinion if displayed on the last slide, so the learner can travel away from the module AFTER completeing it.
 
Let me know if you need any other language or references.
 
Best,
Dustin Puehler

subject: Diligent & misc. stuff
body:
Hi Cecilia,
Happy Friday!
A few notes:
I will be 
out of the office
 this afternoon & Monday, but I will check emails. If you need something from me, please email me
I think we should keep our 
call with Diligent on Tues
, even if we don't have anything open. I want them to know we are committed to them & available to them.
I think you should still send the
 Excel doc/summary
 to the Diligent team on Monday (or prior to the Tues call) and list anything that has been recently completed or is outstanding. For example, this GXO Quote is still awaiting a response from Diligent/GXO 
https://lcw.scoro.com/quotes/view/1565
. 
Dustin lateness
 - regarding him being late with the last project... It would be great if we could be more proactive with Diligent. For example, if you see that Dustin is late, proactively reach out to him to find out what's going on & then report back to the client 
before 
they have the chance to follow up with us 🙂. I'd rather us reach out first to explain the delay than them coming to us.
Dustin processes
 - up to you, but just a thought... Maybe it would be easier for Dustin to create the process docs first, and then you have a chat with him to discuss?? Again, this is totally up to you. I'm just thinking that maybe that would be better than you writing everything up. You could give him 1 process to do (like Diligent Code of Conduct), review it, re-work the formatting, make sure if has everything you need, talk to him about it... And then once the format is agreed upon & he understands what info he needs to give you, then he can do the other docs.
I'm not trying to micromanage here... It really is just a suggestion. But feel free to do it however you want. I may not be able to join the calls bc my schedule has been crazy!
I did not forget about 
onboarding docs for translators
. Will look at that by next week. Will try to get to it this morning.
LMK if you have any questions/thoughts.
Thank you Cecilia!
Nicole Barile
 
(She/Her)
Chief Operating Officer
LCW
